Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland is looking to build upon its seven-game win streak with a victory against Los Angeles.
The Lakers are 10-4 on their home court, allowing 114.1 points per game.
The Cavaliers are 11-3 on the road, ranking fourth in the Eastern Conference with 34.1 defensive rebounds per game led by Jarrett Allen averaging 7.7.
The Lakers average 11.8 made 3-pointers per game, while the Cavaliers allow 13.5 per game.
Anthony Davis is scoring 26.0 points per game with 11.5 rebounds and 3.5 assists for the Lakers.
Darius Garland is shooting 49.9% and averaging 20.7 points for the Cavaliers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers average 111.2 points, 42.6 rebounds, 26.3 assists, 8.7 steals, and 6.0 blocks per game while shooting 47.0% from the field.
The Cavaliers average 123.6 points, 45.1 rebounds, 30.4 assists, 9.3 steals, and 3.8 blocks per game while shooting 49.3% from the field.
The Cavaliers have a strong defensive presence, ranking fourth in the Eastern Conference with 34.1 defensive rebounds per game.
Others: The game is expected to be high-scoring with the Cavaliers averaging 123.6 points and the Lakers allowing 114.1 points per game.
Key player matchups include Anthony Davis and Darius Garland.
